column4: I've had 5.04 on my machine for a week and my update manager is still saying there are no updates. Are there really no updates? (I find that very strange if true)
hoary is now only getting security and major bugfixes
there is a bug filed about it
Ubuntu does not update stable releases with new versions of applications
but the version they picked was broken and only released for 3 days
this issue is well known and they are evaluated options

I don't see why somebody hasn't updated the package from the current 1.8.2 release. Having just switched over from Gentoo I don't see why it's that big of a deal, or maybe it is. I'm sure the package would not have changed much since it just incorporates some bug fixes.
basically the policy is no new versions, because if they break things, you have bad news
did you read the comment from Sebastian Bacher on that bug?
I didn't see his comments in that link
if I knew how to build packages I'd attempt to fix the problem.
pbuilder questions are probably better asked in #ubuntu-motu
